sub_title: Section Head SSH Netherlands sScience Center, Archaeologist, PhD
summary:
Section Head Social Sciences & Humanities at the Netherlands eScience center. 
Archaeologist, PhD, National Geographic Explorer. 

Research | Field Archaeology | GIS, spatial analysis | Geochemistry, mineralogy | Teaching/Training | Line management/coaching 

I have started a new adventure as a section head at the Netherlands eScience center, the Dutch national centre with the digital skills to create innovative software solutions in all scientific disciplines, including the social sciences and humanities, which is my domain.

I am also the scientific director of an archaeological project in Oman, and I am the co-founder and co-director of the Field School Time of Magan (Oman).

*Curiosity as a philosophy of life*

courses.name: Qualification Maître de Conférences (= Lecturer) - Conseil National des Universités (France)

profile_positions.description:
Line-managing a team of 15/18 research software engineers working in SSH projects in collaboration with partners at Dutch universities and academic institutions.
Representing the Netherlands eScience Center in the SSH scientific domain, networking and fostering connections with Dutch SSH universities, research/cultural institutions and SSH infrastructures.
profile_positions.title: Section Head - Social Sciences and Humanities

profile_positions.description:
Direction of a field school in archaeology (with A. De Rorre); Traineeship Supervisor.  
Supervision and training of BA/MA students. Focus: excavation techniques; field documentation; topographic tools; sorting out and recording of finds in databases; complementary teaching/lectures; experimental archaeology.
profile_positions.title: Field School Director

profile_positions.description: "Building Complexity: Building techniques and craft specialisation in Early Bronze Age Eastern Arabia" – Marie Sklodowska-Curie Actions Horizon2020 (agreement n° 707404) – Research program based on the geochemical, mineralogical and petrographic characterisation of building materials.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher, Marie Curie Fellow (COFUND LEaDing Fellows)

profile_positions.description: Lecturer, BA2/BA3/pre-master "Archaeology of Arabia" (5 EC), co-teaching with B. Düring, UL Faculty of Archaeology, Leiden.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
Invited guest lectures during the academic years 2018/2019 and 2019/2020 at Leiden University Faculty of Archaeology. 

Courses:
-Near Eastern Archaeology (P. Akkermans). 
-Ritual and Religion in the Ancient Near East (A. Politopoulos). 
-Archaeology of Arabia (B. Düring).
profile_positions.title: Guest Lecturer

company.name: The Ras al-Jinz Project / Archaeological Excavations at Ras al-Jinz RJ-3

profile_positions.company: The Ras al-Jinz Project / Archaeological Excavations at Ras al-Jinz RJ-3
profile_positions.description: Excavation at the Early Bronze Age settlement of Ras al-Jinz RJ-3. | 3 months/year | Co-Dir. A. De Rorre
profile_positions.title: Project Director

profile_positions.description:
Sorting out and analysis of the Joint Hadd Project archives (MAE, Nanterre), aimed at the monographic publication of the JHP 1985-2011 excavations at Ras al-Jinz (Oman). The project includes the reconstruction of stratigraphic sequences, the analysis of architectures, and specialised studies on the material culture.
Documentation campaigns Muscat / Ras al-Jinz (Oman) | Feb 2017; Jan 2018
profile_positions.title: Project Scientific Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
-Support researchers in exploring research and funding opportunities.
-Train researchers for EU and Dutch research grants (e.g. ERC, NWO).
-Assist in the application process, proposal writing, preparing the interview.
-Liaising with granting agencies.
profile_positions.title: Individual Research Grant Officer
